inn1.comm: bit of nibble off the pitch. England favourites! I kid. Jayawardene calmly defends to the off side
serious movement here away from the bat. Hooping swing. Dilshan leaves alone
too wide from Anderson and Dilshan clatters the air with an enormous swish. Swung past the bat though
will there be an extra slip soon? You'd hope so. Anderson is a touch short here and Dilshan leaves alone
gone! Dilshan departs for a duck! Anderson pitched it up, the late swing found the edge and Kieswetter took the chance
big, late swing past the groping edge of Chandimal. Anderson loves these conditions and is full of chat at Chandimal
starts too wide, and a touch short. Left all alone
again Jayawardene leaves alone outside off stump, watching a ball hoop past him
wide of off stump for a third time
Bresnan straightens up and Jayawardene fiddles a single around the corner. Brings Chandimal back on strike
back of a length from Bresnan. Chandimal rocks into line to poke to leg. England full of chatter at the 21-year-old
too wide of off this time. Not a great opening over, it must be said
just a hint of width and Jayawardene carefully threaded his cut shot wide of point for four. Be great to see how he adapts to these conditions
this time it's outside off and left alone. Anderson gets an ovation from Kieswetter for the effort
ah, cricketing gods, presumably the same one Cook was invoking the other day, prevent swing when you start on leg stump. Instead it heads past for a wide
this again is shoved a touch down the leg side and Jayawardene flicks merrily to deep square
good delivery this one, tailing away late. Jayawardene was desperate to turn it to leg but resisted the temptation and played straight
just a fraction short - maybe half a metre - means Jayawardene can play off the back foot and steer with the swing to third man
Anderson finds some extra bounce that Chandimal doesn't cope with too well as he pops forward. Almost spoons it to cover. Anderson is full of choreographed chat again
Bresnan persisting back of a length. Jayawardene blocks calmly
big wicket! Jayawardene falls and he'll be disappointed with the shot. Just flirted at an away swinger outside off, could easily have left it but ended up edging to slip
plays his first ball very late and under his eyes, prodding to leg
Bresnan lands it outside a right-hander's off stump, but Sangakkara is left handed
adjusts perfectly this time, sliding past the outside edge. Dreamy bowling conditions these
Sangakkara eases forward to defend to cover
fuller delivery, Sangakkara leaves by playing inside the line. It would take a massive effort to turn this into a good score in these conditions

Chandimal over this time! Don't play England when the ball nips around! He was only half-forward when an inswinger clipped his front pad around the knee roll on off stump. Century followed by a duck for the 21-year-old
angled across the left-hander, Kandamby defends. Still just two slips in place, much to the annoyance of the Sky comm box
shortish and pushed across blocked. But with the ball doing what it is you can't see Kandamby lasting
careful blocking from Kandamby. Anderson probably a touch short
back of a length again and defended to cover
some extra bounce here for Bresnan. So pace, bounce, seam and swing on offer. Sangakkara rides it well, plays late in defence
England are full of cheer, bounding around like puppies. Amazing what a green pitch does. Defended to the leg side
neatly clipped off the toes to deep square
Bresnan shoves down a short ball and looks anxiously to the square leg umpire. Thankfully for the bowler, it's not a wide. Must have been close though
Kandamby is away, and neatly too. Assured clip off the hip towards deep square
Bresnan short again and Kandamby is very late on a pull shot. Bresnan so often seems to hurry batsmen with short balls
swing, carry, decent pace. Everything on offer. But it's pushed across Sangakkara and left alone
back of a length from the bowler and nibbled into the leg side
ooh, Kandamby late on a leave  and it ended up taking an inside edge and running this far past the stumps
more secure this time, blocking to cover
fuller delivery, real floater, is driven firmly but Bell at cover dives to field. So pleased are England with the effort that they pat him lovingly
cracker! Angling away before zipping back and slicing Kandamby in two as he tried to defend
Bresnan finds the right length it heads across a limp bat. Real tough battle for the batsmen here
again this nips away but Sangakkara opts to leave
you can't get away swing from outside leg stump, that's the rules
pushed outside off stump and Sangakkara leaves
go full, and the rest follows. Draws Sangakkara forward to try and play but tails away past the edge
this time it's driven with the fullest of faces straight back down the ground but Bresnan intervenes
sturdy defence, playing it very late from Prince Kumar, as many of you have corrected me
lovely shot from Kandamby! He looks remarkably similar to Hashan Tillakaratne at the crease. Leans into a drive that's punched wide of cover for four
this time it's defended as Anderson adjusts his line
all over for Kandamby! Didn't need to play it but was drawn into a little fence outside off with an open face, ended up guiding it to slip
doesn't get much of this as Anderson swing it into his pads
again this dips back towards the pads and Randiv can't connect
bouncer dragged down short. Randiv eases out the line
gentle, floating gimme from Bresnan and Sangakkara climbs into a beautiful cover drive. Lovely shot
follows the boundary with a leg-side nudge for a single
Randiv doing his duty well so far, into line and fiddling to leg
Bresnan aims full but less floaty than the first ball. Snakes away late, past the hopeful attempted drive
shorter this time, Randiv rides the bounce and plays well to defend
wrong line from Bresnan and classic nightwatchman runs, inside-edging off the pads to the fine-leg boundary
good line and length from Anderson and Sangakkara can do nothing but defend
more careful defence from Sangakkara. Not convinced these conditions are fit for ODI cricket but there you go. Mind you, Sri Lanka haven't played them well at all
solid defence straight back down to the bowler
dug in short and there is plenty of carry. Sangakkara only has to pop under to avoid
excellent batting, short-arm cut shot to a short ball only a fraction wide of off. Picked the gap wide of point and it raced to the rope
calm defence to follow the boundary
starts full! Actually full! Randiv, after recovering from surprise, managed to get forward to defend
four this time! Broad's bad luck? Perhaps he should have been fuller. Good ball though, moved away and a half-guide half-edge steered it past a diving second slip
again Broad is full, which is promising. Randiv gets himself forward to defend
Broad isn't haring in like he was the games before. The conditions do the leg work really. Finds a good hit-off-stump line and length and Randiv defends
where has that come from!? Randiv strolls down the wicket, gives himself room and clatters a boundary over cover!
Broad resists the temptation to slam down a bouncer in response and Randiv resists the temptation to swing wildly. Good cricket, all things considered
flash and a miss outside off. Not really sure why Sangakkara missed it, just some extra bounce I guess
nicely done. Sangakkara up on his  toes, pops a single to leg
good running pinches a single as Anderson swings one into Randiv's pads
touch of uneven bounce now! Good grief. Sangakkara leaves and watches it roll through to Kieswetter
for some reason Pietersen is out at deep midwicket. Not sure why, but that means Sangakkara's inside edge earns a single
Randiv shuffles down at Anderson very early and the bowler slams it down short in response. That pretty much takes the bowler's threat away so credit to Randiv
Broad's first real short ball of the day and Sangakkara hung leg side of the ball to chop a cut shot down to third man
full and straight from Broad. And Randiv in defence
poor shot, poking outside off stump. Back of a length and it ghosted past the edge
little bit too short and wide here, but not alarmingly so
Randiv is playing a blinder, given the conditions. Into line again and blocking securely
short and wide, not ideal from the bowler, Randiv hangs leg side and upper-cuts, Broad thinks he's in with a chance but it bounces a couple of times to third man
Randiv edging down the track again, Anderson shoving it in short again in response and it thuds off the thigh
Anderson is definitely bowling too short to Randiv here. Wrong line too and it's tickled away off the body to fine leg
better delivery, fuller and zipping away. Sangakkara fenced at it, much to his annoyance
too short and the pull shot is nailed. Perfect timing, perfect placement between the two deep fielders. Lovely batting
good crisp pull is followed by an equally decisive leave
left all alone outside off stump
a good length delivery on off stump is defended back down the track. A touch of seam movement in to the batsman, but nothing dramatic
seaming in towards the hip, Randiv tucks to leg for a single
nicely full but just a little too straight, Sangakkara works to midwicket for one more
shot! Randiv has the look of a top-order batsman as he leans forward to crack a drive through the covers. No great flourish, but his technique is sound and the placement is great
Broad pulls his length back just a touch and Randiv defends to point

sweet relief! Randiv gloves a lifter down the leg side, and Broad's wait is over. It wasn't the most impressive piece of bowling ever seen, but he'll take a wicket any way he can get it. To his credit, he also immediately turned to appeal to the umpire as the ball landed in Kieswetter's gloves. He's smiling now
he starts on a length just outside off, and Sangakkara defends from the crease
Kumar looks for a single through gully but can't get the ball fine enough
short of a good length, on this pitch, and Sangakkara defends off the back foot
chopped down through gully, this time the placement is good and he picks up one to third man. Still a little short from Dernbach
he's off straight away, clipping a pitched up delivery through midwicket
nibbling around just outside off, Sangakkara steps across to cover off stump and leaves alone
rising off a length outside off, Mathews has a look and leaves well alone
left alone once again, but this is one was much closer to his off stump. Gasps from behind the wicket
full of length but far enough outside off to be left alone without alarm
Mathews skips down the track to get at Broad, who adjusts his length and line to draw a hurried defence from the batsman
just short of a good length, Mathews hangs back and gets in line to defend
that's better - aimed at the top of off stump - but it's also cost runs, Mathews nudging to midwicket for a single
Dernbach spots Mathews' attacking intent - the batsman was hinting that he would advance down the wicket - and bangs one in short
Dernbach's line drifts down the leg side and he is neatly glanced to the fine leg boundary
landing on middle and leg this time, and Mathews flicks to midwicket for a single
definite seam movement away from the left-hander, but it starts wide of off and goes further and Kumar isn't interested in playing a shot
Sangakkara didn't have much room to work with here but slashed a cut away behind point all the same. Too close to him to get any real power in the shot
nurdled defensively to leg to end the over
beaten on the outside edge. That was loose from Sangakkara, he flashed at a wide half-volley with minimal foot movement
on a length and straight, Sangakkara defends
chopped down defensively on the off side. Hint of bottom edge
deftly angled down to third man for a single
this one spat back at Mathews off a length, and he is forced into a hurried defensive stroke as the ball rises up at his midriff
Broad's line slips towards leg stump and he's nudged behind square for a single
a loopy full toss is pushed to long-on for a single
speared down flat from around the wicket, Sangakkara defends to leg with his weight back
nudged to cover, Sangakkara was searching for a single but there wasn't one as the fielder quickly swooped, the batsman scurrying quickly back to his crease
pushed gently to cover off the front foot once again
width offered outside off, Sangakkara cuts well behind square but a sliding fielder cuts it off on the boundary
tight single! Dinked to cover and they have to sprint through quickly as the throw is fired in ... the call was nice and early though
some more cheeky running! Mathews had to get the dive out this time, after Sangakkara had dropped the ball close in on the off side. He was safely in
that is a shot of true quality! A checked drive is eased straight back over the bowler's head and flies several metres over the boundary. Such clean striking, and he never lost control or balance
Dernbach responds by pulling his length back and going wider of off stump, Mathews leaves alone
tapped to cover, there's time for a quick single
full on off stump, Sangakkara slices a drive that is stopped at point by Morgan
full and straight, Sangakkara nudges straight to the midwicket fielder
tossed up full on off stump, Mathews digs it out into the leg side

this is close! The straight-break fizzes past the outside edge of Mathews' bat and Kieswetter whips the bails off. The umpires immediately go upstairs for another look ... but, fortunately for Sri Lanka, his back foot was grounded the whole time
full and quite flat outside off, Mathews nudges to point
Mathews leans across and taps quietly to midwicket
pushed to midwicket again, a risk-free shot
Mathews lunges well forward to defend to cover, and that's a maiden for Swann
Sangakkara guides a length delivery to third man, turns quickly and runs the second hard. Good running
glanced off the hip down to fine leg, this time it's just the single
much too short, the attempted bouncer sails way over Mathews' head and is rightly called a wide by Illingworth
Mathews shows his intent by stepping aggressively forward, but is met with a good length delivery aimed at the top of middle and defends
slower ball from Dernbach, the first of the innings as far as I can remember. Mathews seemed to pick it, but it was wide of off and he chose not to play a shot

this would've been very close with a direct hit! Mathews tapped to cover and there was a moment's hesitation before they set off, but Samit Patel's throw is wide. He may have been just home even if it had hit
flicked into the leg side for a single to end the over

Swann comes round the wicket to Sangakkara, who pushes to Anderson in the covers and begins to set off for a single ... he's swiftly sent back, and Kieswetter can't get a glove on the fielder's slightly wild return
pushed into the off side again, no thought of a run this time
Sangakkara stays deep in the crease and punches down to long-off for one
definite drift for Swann but not much turn, and Mathews defends
nudged defensively to leg
quicker one from Swann, it's glanced just to short fine leg's left and there's no chance of a single
full and straight, Sangakkara steps forward to drive to mid-on
Sangakkara advances down the track and Dernbach responds by digging the ball in. It's fended to leg, and Mathews says no to the single
whipped to long leg, and they charge through for a second
a genuine edge off Sangakkara's bat to one that seamed across him off a really good length, but there are no slips and it goes fine enough to get him four runs at third man
a similar delivery, but this time Sangakkara is right behind it in defence
hurled down the leg side to add another to the extras column
short of a good length on off stump, Sangakkara stands up to cover the bounce and defends to midwicket
dropped close in towards cover point and the batsmen take a well-judged single
a quicker one is arrowed in at off stump from around the wicket, but Sangakkara eases it down the ground for a single
nudged through square leg for another single
a mirror image of the last stroke, Sangakkara bringing up the 100 by turning one to square leg
solidly defended off the front foot
intelligent batting from Mathews, who opens the bat face on a drifter outside off to pick up three to third man
angling down the leg side, Mathews is struck on the pad but that's definitely missing, the appeal is turned down and they take a single
very full on off stump, Sangakkara digs the ball out to mid-off - who is too deep, allowing them the single
Mathews sends the ball racing towards the third man boundary with a late cut ... but a slick, sliding stop from Bresnan saves a couple of runs
whipped to midwicket, a slight fumble means they have time to get back for a second run.
Broad draws Mathews forward in defence with a full ball on off stump
Broad ends the over with another nicely full ball, but it's met with solid defence again
angled in towards the left-hander's pads from round the wicket, and he's turned to fine leg for a single
tapped to square leg, there's another single
it's all happening! Turn, an edge off the bat, and Mathews is sent back very late ... but he gets between the fielder and the stumps, and the throw isn't a great one. Swann isn't happy
nudged into the leg side
driven down the ground for a single
the leg glance sends the ball racing towards the long leg boundary, but again Bresnan is the fielder to save runs down there
Sangakkara unfurls his cut shot to send the ball bouncing to wide third man, but there's cover there, the fielder sprinting round
Broad hits a length on off stump, Mathews defends from the crease
a very full ball on off stump is dug out to cover
Mathews' second six of the innings! It doesn't quite have the style and panache of his first - there's a hint of the agricultural as he smites a Broad offcutter over long-on. Good shot all the same
flicked to leg for two more
this skids through from Swann, past the attempted whip to leg
neatly played, stylishly driving through cover
Mathews bunts a single down the ground. Good milking
again Swann is eased to long-on
touch of air on this, drift too. Defended calmly
ooh, Sangakkara hurried half-way down for a nonexistant single, and then took an age to turn and get back. Made Samit Patel look lively
Sangakkara uses the slight width on offer to guide a single to third man
banged down shorter, two men out deep for the hook so Mathews decides on ducking

great work from Bresnan! Key breakthrough! Short ball reared up and took the shoulder of Mathews' bat as he tried to turn it to leg, it looped back towards the bowler who ran in, dived and snaffled it with one-hand inches off the turf. Mathews demanded the third umpire took a second look but that only confirmed how good a catch it was
accurate start to the new batsman and Mendis defends
good stuff from Bresnan again, holding the ball around off stump
oh dear, horrid shot. Hack across the line. Not sure that's the right approach
poked to the leg side gently
terrible running from Mendis, calling Sangakkara through for a single after it bobbled off the pads. Kieswetter was swift and had his throw hit Sangakkara would have gone
Mendis forward and defending very respectfully
diligent defence from Mendis after his earlier swish
Mendis just holding his bat in line and letting it hit the the bat
more conviction on this forward defence
fifty for Sangakkara, what an immense man. Guides this to third man boundary easily. He's had to battle so hard this innings
dabbed to the off side and the batsmen scoot through for a very swift single. Needed a dive to get home as Morgan's throw hit direct
neatly played by Mendis, tucking a short ball off his hip to deep square
short and a touch wide, Sangakkara cuts but straight to point
banged in shorter and it was quick too. Sangakkara had to jerk out the line
enough width for Sangakkara to steer a single to third man and pinch the strike
waits on the back foot and flicks a single to the legside
another quick single this time taken to the offside
punched with a full face to deep mid-off
lovely bowling from Swann, drifting it in and Mendis almost got himself out of position
slides on with the arm to find an inside edge as Mendis drove loosely. Inside edge ran towards short fine leg
five singles in the over as Sangakkara punches to mid-off
starts well here though, heading for around off stump
slightly shorter this time, pushing across the left-hander. Sangakkara defends very securely
slower ball, out the back of the hand as usual, Sangakkara pokes it past a diving Kieswetter and then seems to dance to the other end, very slowly
Dernbach bent has back here and the extra pace did for Mendis who tried to leave. The inside edge comes back close to the stumps, but not close enough for Bresnan's liking
this is left outside off stump and left all alone
pitched up invitingly to drive, Mendis does drive, but finds cover
nudged quietly to deep square to bring Mendis, who is struggling a touch, back on strike
big appeal from Swann as Mendis shuffles across his stumps and misses. Looked a good shout I reckon
better shot this one, chopped backwards of point
Sangakkara places his drive down the ground to jog another single
Kieswetter screams "bowled Swanny!" after Mendis defends
quick feet from Mendis down the track gets him to the pitch to drive a single. Nicely done
Mendis picks out Morgan at point with his back-foot steer
that's an excellent shot! Brings up 150 for Sri Lanka. It was only a touch short but Mendis got back and short-arm jabbed a pull shot in front of square for four
loose delivery, shoved well outside off is slashed at and missed
another swing and miss from Mendis. Poor shot this, hanging back and trying to fetch a pull from a long way outside off
cracker from Dernbach! Where did this come from? Fuller, which helps, but decked off the pitch a long way and beat the outside edge

dropped! Dernbach deserved more! Another good delivery seaming away, this time it found the edge it went wide to Kieswetter's left and he had it as he dived but it popped out as the elbows hit the ground
dangerous trying to cut Swann, very dangerous. Mendis just about gave himself enough room to squeeze the shot out
Mendis down the wicket this time and flicking with a flourish to Pietersen at deep midwicket
Sangakkara very respectful in defence
more careful defence from Sangakkara, he's almost seen Swann out
shorter delivery and Sangakkara rocks back to punch a drive wide of cover

Swann almost strikes on the last ball of his spell. Quicker ball that slid through, struck Mendis on the pad as he was half forward. Bowden decided against it but replays showed leg stump being easy hit
Sangakkara chops a single down to third man. He's been playing a different match to his team-mates today
Mendis defends uneasily off the back foot

Broad gets another and Kieswetter will be thrilled! Tough chance as Mendis slashed at a short ball, top edge flew through but Kieswetter jumped at just the right moment to cling on. Broad's luck must be changing because he has two wickets with two pretty ordinary deliveries today
Broad is a touch wide to the new batsman
wrong line again, this time down the leg side, Kulasekara nudges a single to fine leg
very neatly driven to long-on to keep Sangakkara the strike
Bresnan starts with a pinpoint yorker in the blockhole, and it's dug out to leg
he's just missed his mark with the yorker this time, and the full toss is tapped back to the bowler ... who falls over it without stopping the ball, allowing the single
Kulasekara hops back to push a length delivery to midwicket
short, just outside off, and Kulasekara sways out of harm's way
heaved to midwicket! Another length delivery from Bresnan, Kulasekara cleared the left leg and swung merrily to send the ball arcing away
Bresnan goes much fuller to end the over, and Kulasekara clips through square leg
full, straight, Kulasekara is struck plumb in front and it's an easy decision for umpire Illingworth. Hmm, in fact replays suggest that wasn't as close as it looked at first, just clipping leg
the bump ball is tapped to Bell in the covers ... the crowd were very excited, thinking that was a wicket
a slower one outside off, and I'm not entirely sure Malinga picked this. Doesn't lay bat on ball
on a length at full pace, Malinga defends from the crease
the middle stump is knocked out of the ground! Malinga backed to leg and swished at a full toss aimed at the base of middle, missing completely. Another wicket for Dernbach, and isn't he happy
another full toss from Dernbach, tailing in through the air, and Lakmal defends to leg.
Sangakkara jumps out of his crease and swipes to midwicket, where a diving stop from Pietersen saves the boundary. Sri Lanka's chances of reaching a competitive total rest entirely with him now
a sharp yorker is dug out back to the bowler
shot! Sangakkara backs to leg to give himself some room and scythes a low full-toss over cover. That's taken him to his highest score against England in ODIs
Sangakkara nudges to midwicket but turns down the single
uppercut, over backward point, and that's four more! Sangakkara keeps fighting for his team, these are really valuable runs
but he doesn't get it, a low, dipping full-toss is tapped straight to Trott at extra cover
he's desperate to get off strike! Lakmal nudges a slower ball straight to the fielder in the covers and starts to wander down the pitch, swiftly sent back by Sangakkara
there's the single Sri Lanka wanted, Lakmal digging a yorker out to midwicket where Anderson is close in, but not close enough to stop a quick single
Dernbach comes round the wicket to Sangakkara and loops down a slower ball. Sangakkara was too soon into a slog to leg, the ball trickling into the gap ... but he turns down the single
there's the wicket! Sangakkara swings across the line and a leading edge loops up on the off side ... Morgan gets himself underneath it at backward point and takes the catch to end the innings

inn2.comm: gentle enough start, full outside off stump and Cook can leave alone. He can plod all he likes with this target
again Kulasekara is full, touch wide though, Cook flags it through again
straighter this time from Kulasekara. Cook is back and defending
Cook is away, England are away. In good style too as Cook rocks forward to push a half-volley with the fullest of faces straight back past the bowler for four
four more! This wasn't as well timed but Cook stretched forward and drove square - with a touch of edge - past point
three in a row! Alastair Jayasuriya! Shortish and down the leg side, Cook helped it fine off his hip and it scooted away to the rope
England are motoring. Kieswetter gets a full ball on his pads and with minimum of fuss, clips wide of mid-on for another boundary
Malinga drags his length back and around off stump. Kieswetter defends very earnestly and yells "Nooo"
Kieswetter lifts his bat up menacingly but decides to leave alone
touch of extra bounce here startles Kieswetter as he pops forward to defend
solidly blocked to point. Malinga has been good since that first delivery
good over, bar the first ball, Kieswetter leaves alone
good line and length from Kulasekara outside off. Cook eases forward and leaves alone
squirts off the face wide of point to exchange the strike
Kieswetter forward and very orthodox in defence
outside edge found, but a thickish one that runs to Jayawardene at a wide slip who dives well to field
back of a length around off stump and Kieswetter is again careful in defence
Kulasekara gets one to nip back from a length and past the inside edge onto the thigh pad
don't bowl there to Alastair Cook! Short with width. Cook leant back and crashed it straight at point, who couldn't stop it and it flew to the boundary
better delivery this time, full, which is the key. Straight too. Cook pushes to mid-off
this skims very low off the wicket, Cook was hanging back but stayed out of trouble by jabbing down in time
clipped off the pads to midwicket
good delivery heading to the top of off until Cook intercepted with crisp defence
with Dilshan deep at mid-on Cook is happy to risk a single with a push straight to him. Not sure that was a good move though, if the throw had hit Cook would have gone
poor delivery, really poor ball. Floated full and outside leg stump, Cook turned his writs over the ball and collected another boundary
again it's leg-sided from Kulasekara and Cook flicks powerfully through midwicket this time
looks a rather good batting track all of a sudden! Kieswetter eases forward and pushes this through the covers. Great timing because it sped to the boundary
calmly forward in defence this time
this is what he's there to do. Kieswetter jumps down the wicket and hacks, inside edge but it found a gap past square leg and away for another boundary
solid forward defence this time as Kulasekara hits the right length and line
Lakmal starts wide, pushing across the left-hander and left alone
short and wide of off to Cook won't end happily for the bowler. Cook again leans back and cracks a square cut past point for four
this was really middled again as Lakmal got his length wrong. Luckily for the bowler this time he finds point
not a particularly great ball outside off, but left alone nonetheless
Lakmal adjusts his length but overdoes it, ends up floating up a half-volley that Cook leans into and creams through cover for another boundary. His seventh
Alastair Gayle rocks forward to block to cover. But look out, it's getting pretty dark
gingerly drags himself to the crease and starts with a touch of width that Kieswetter chops to third man
good delivery here from Mathews, heading to off stump, Cook forward in defence
slower delivery is worked off the pads around the corner
Kieswetter strikes the ball cleanly to point
too short from Mathews, Kieswetter waits and eases his pull shot between the two fielders on the leg-side boundary. Brings up the 50 stand and it's been rapid
better ball to finish but there's no halting England at the moment
good delivery this, fullish and straight. Cook pushes to mid-on
very nicely timed off the back foot but straight to cover
good delivery again from Lakmal but Cook is timing his back-foot shots very well, even in defence
floaty half-volley and Cook has all of it. Leans into a drive that is crashed through the infield
good start after the break from both Lakmal and Cook. The bowler finding an excellent line and length, Cook defending very solidly
Cook flays at some width on offer but can't time it
starts with a bouncer, which at his pace is a brave effort. It crept over Kieswetter as he ducked
steered with an open face to third man
Alastair Gilchrist whips off his thigh for his ninth boundary. Terrible delivery at Mathews' pace really
much better from Mathews, finds a good length around off stump. Cook blocks
shortish ball turned to leg with a flick of the wrists
Kieswetter is completely fooled by a slower ball as he tries to run it to third man. Passes the bat and dribbles through to the keeper
especially if you bowl there. A long way outside leg stump
better line from Malinga and Cook presents the fullest of faces in response
Malinga finds an outside edge as Cook pushes forward but it heads off harmlessly to third man
this is blocked calmly
dug in short but it's wide of off stump. Kieswetter lets it go but the umpire doesn't
flash, an edge, and four. That's what Kieswetter should be all about! Slower ball from Malinga, Kieswetter threw his quick hands at it and no slip ensured no problem
pretty much a replay here except Kieswetter missed it
excellent yorker this time almost squeezes through but a inside edge not only saves Kieswetter but earns him a single
slower bouncer to start from Mathews, Kieswetter is through his pull shot long before the ball arrives
another short one but this time steered to third man, there was a collision between batsman and bowler as Kieswetter ran
short again and Kieswetter is this time much more controlled on his pull shot
Cook loves clipping off his hip, collects two with a minimum of fuss or effort and is now just a boundary away from fifty
fifty for Cook! Just 37 balls! Get's there by whipping a boundary off his pads through square leg. Gentle bowling it may be, but he couldn't have done it any better
pushed away into space to keep the strike
ooh, that's a really, really good shot. Shades of Kumar in this. Cook eased forward and placed the bat in line, the ball shot off straight past the bowler for four
slower ball finds an inside-edge onto pad. Malinga appeals but with no real conviction
finally a false shot as Cook is turned inside out, but no alarm
again Malinga heads down the leg side, much to the umpire's dislike
wow, Cook four more! Really poor bowling and Cook is feasting. Half-volley on the pads clipped past the infield for Cook's 12th boundary
outside off stump this time and Cook can leave alone knowing he won't get any stick for it
full face of the bat places this through the off side
not yet, first dead-bat defence
dragged short by the bowler and Cook drags it from off stump down the ground
Kieswetter walks into a forward defence

should have had spin earlier! Kieswetter runs down the wicket, aims a huge yaweee, outside edges past the keeper and, despite a very serious and needless dive from Jayawardene on the chase,  it's four
stabbed down to long-on
nibbled leg side for another strike-stealing single
starts straight, skidding towards off stump. Cook blocks
only a hint short but Cook does a passable Eoin Morgan impression by hopping back and pulling powerfully in front of square for four
after the boundary comes the single, worked down the ground
fired down the leg side. Too far for anyone's liking
Kieswetter punches this down the ground to maintain his run-a-ball rate
don't let Cook cut. He's really good at it. Rocks back and throws his arms at the width. His 14th boundary, which is the most he's ever done in an ODI innings
blocked to end another very good over for England
Kieswetter pokes a single to the leg side to bring his captain back on strike
Cook returns the favour with a very similar leg-side fiddle
Kieswetter jumps leg side to try and run this past the slip but gets too much of it
this time there is a firm forward push  to change the strike
huge appeal from Sangakkara from behind the stumps. Looked very good on first viewing but possibly hit outside off
Cook shimmies down the track and flicks a couple
good start, tapped back to the bowler
full and straight, nudged back to Dilshan along the ground
a touch too straight, Kieswetter works with what little spin there is to flick the ball to square leg
there's half an appeal from Dilshan as Cook bends into a sweep and is rapped on the pad, but he's hit a good foot outside off stump
width offered outside off, and Cook slaps the ball out to the cover sweeper
muscled down to long-on for a single - and there we have it, another over without a boundary!
he comes round the wicket to Kieswetter, who glances to midwicket for one
a proactive sweep from Cook, and he hits it well but picks out the square leg fielder
a thick inside edge off an expansive drive, and they take a single as the ball rolls into the leg side
chopped hard into the ground on the off side, extra cover sprints in to stop the single
looped up slightly slower in the air, Kieswetter played back and there would've been a roared appeal had he not got the bat in the way of this one
pushed into the off side for a single, and England's cruise to a series-levelling win continues
flighted up on middle and off, driven back to the bowler
Kieswetter dances down the track and gets well inside the line of a flighted offspinner, smashing the ball past a diving mid-off
again Kieswetter uses his feet, but Dilshan holds this one back and it grips and spins a touch too. Watchfully played into the leg side
Cook stays back and forces to cover
a premeditated paddle-sweep from England's one-day captain, and he gets the ball down to fine leg
angled down to short third man for a single
Randiv comes round the wicket to Kieswetter, who bends into a slog sweep that sends the ball deep into the stands at midwicket! And that takes him to fifty as well. Great way to get there
fired in quicker and fuller, Kieswetter whips it off his toes for one
tossed up on middle, Cook leans forward to drive to long-on
Kieswetter flashes outside off, and is beaten
this time he gets bat on ball, aiming a late cut down to third man, and sprinting through for three before it's hauled back in
full outside off, Cook drives to wide long-off
he's a touch short to start, Cook hops back and flicks through square leg
flighted really high, the ball dips and lands on a middle stump line. There's some turn on offer, but it's really slow and Kieswetter has no trouble adjusting
a long-hop is cracked out to deep cover ... they briefly think about the second
wrong 'un from Mendis, Cook is hit on the pad and there's a highly optimistic appeal - it landed well outside leg
pushed through mid-off for a single
driven hard to mid-on
a high full toss is creamed out to deep square, the ball swept with great power
eased to long-off for a single
flighted up just outside off, Kieswetter stretches forward to defend
bounce and a hint of turn for Randiv, and Kieswetter is hit on the thigh as he attempts to work to leg
Kieswetter lunges forward to smother another flighted delivery outside off
tapped quietly back to the bowler to end the over
this wasn't all that short, but Cook picked up the length really quickly and smashed a pull out to deep midwicket. He's into the 90s now!
swept down to fine leg, where a sliding stop saves the boundary
driven down to long-on with plenty of bottom hand
heaved straight back over the bowlers head! Kieswetter opened up his stance and just swung his arms cleanly through the line
chopped to backward point, there's no single to be had
muscled out to deep midwicket, there's balance and power in the shot, and placement too. Shades of Shane Watson ...
no warm-up ball for Malinga, he just sprints in and delivers a perfect yorker, well kept out by Cook
another very full ball, though this one is wide of off and Cook drives over the top of it
dug out to cover for one more
Malinga digs in a bouncer, but it's a fairly toothless one and Kieswetter ducks underneath it easily
full, straight and fast. Kieswetter jams the ball to mid-on
another perfect blockhole delivery, and Kieswetter does well just to keep that away from his stumps
Cook steps right across to off, exposing leg and middle stumps, and clips a low full toss out to deep square ... just the single
Kieswetter dances down and slams a length ball straight at the cover fielder. He's not playing for Cook's ton
what a strike! Real flamboyant stuff from Kieswetter, who comes down and smears the ball over midwicket, raising one leg off the ground as he does so
tapped to mid-off
Kieswetter glances a low full-toss to square leg, where the fielder dives but can only parry it and allow the batsmen to sprint through and complete a crushing win
